name: moral_foundations_theory
description: Moral Foundations Theory framework based on Jonathan Haidt's research into the paired moral foundations that underlie human moral reasoning across cultures

coordinate_system.description: Circular coordinate system with opposing foundation pairs

positioning_strategy.description: Five moral foundation dipoles positioned as opposing pairs around the circle

primary_sources: Haidt, J. (2012). The righteous mind: Why good people are divided by politics and religion.

Graham, J., Haidt, J., Koleva, S., Motyl, M., Iyer, R., Wojcik, S., & Ditto, P. H. (2013). Moral foundations theory: The pragmatic validity of moral pluralism. Advances in experimental social psychology, 47, 55-130.
Haidt, J., & Joseph, C. (2004). Intuitive ethics: How innately prepared intuitions generate culturally variable virtues. Daedalus, 133(4), 55-66.
theoretical_foundation.theoretical_approach: Based on Haidt's Moral Foundations Theory which identifies innate psychological foundations that cultures build upon to create diverse moral systems. Each foundation represents an evolved psychological mechanism for addressing adaptive challenges faced by humans living in groups.
theoretical_foundation.core_insight: Human morality is based on several innate psychological foundations, not just care and fairness. People across cultures and political affiliations differ in how much they rely on each foundation.

dipoles.name: Care_Harm
dipoles.description: Foundation evolved from mammalian attachment systems and empathy for suffering

positive.name: Care
positive.description: Concern for the suffering of others, compassion, protection of vulnerable individuals

negative.name: Harm
negative.description: Actions that cause suffering, cruelty, violence, neglect of those in need

dipoles.name: Fairness_Cheating
dipoles.description: Foundation evolved from reciprocal altruism and cooperation challenges

positive.name: Fairness
positive.description: Concern for proportional treatment, justice, reciprocity, equal opportunity

negative.name: Cheating
negative.description: Violations of fairness, exploitation, free-riding, undeserved advantage

dipoles.name: Loyalty_Betrayal
dipoles.description: Foundation evolved from group cooperation and coalition formation

positive.name: Loyalty
positive.description: Commitment to group, patriotism, self-sacrifice for collective good

negative.name: Betrayal
negative.description: Disloyalty to group, treason, putting self above collective

dipoles.name: Authority_Subversion
dipoles.description: Foundation evolved from primate hierarchical social structures

positive.name: Authority
positive.description: Respect for legitimate hierarchy, tradition, leadership, social order

negative.name: Subversion
negative.description: Illegitimate challenge to authority, chaos, disrespect for tradition

dipoles.name: Sanctity_Degradation
dipoles.description: Foundation evolved from disgust psychology and contamination avoidance

positive.name: Sanctity
positive.description: Concerns about spiritual purity, elevated living, sacred values

negative.name: Degradation
negative.description: Contamination, debasement, violation of sacred, moral pollution

weighting_philosophy.description: Hierarchical weighting based on Haidt's research on foundation usage across political affiliations

primary.description: Care and Fairness - emphasize individual welfare and rights

secondary.description: Loyalty and Authority - emphasize group cohesion and order

political_patterns.liberals: Primarily rely on individualizing foundations (Care, Fairness)
political_patterns.conservatives: Rely on all foundations more equally
political_patterns.libertarians: Strong Liberty foundation (when included as 6th foundation)

individualizing_score.name: Individualizing Foundation Score
individualizing_score.description: Strength of Care and Fairness concerns (liberal moral priorities)

binding_score.name: Binding Foundation Score
binding_score.description: Strength of Loyalty, Authority, and Sanctity concerns (conservative moral priorities)

moral_foundation_diversity.name: Moral Foundation Diversity Index
moral_foundation_diversity.description: Breadth of moral concern across all foundations

political_moral_profile.name: Political Moral Profile
political_moral_profile.description: Pattern of foundation usage indicating political orientation

prompt_configuration.expert_role: You are an expert in moral psychology specializing in Jonathan Haidt's Moral Foundations Theory with deep knowledge of how different moral foundations manifest in discourse across cultures and political orientations.
prompt_configuration.analysis_focus: Identify which of Haidt's five moral foundations (Care/Harm, Fairness/Cheating, Loyalty/Betrayal, Authority/Subversion, Sanctity/Degradation) are most strongly present in the text.
prompt_configuration.foundation_definitions: Care/Harm: compassion vs cruelty; Fairness/Cheating: justice vs exploitation; Loyalty/Betrayal: group solidarity vs disloyalty; Authority/Subversion: respect for hierarchy vs rebellion; Sanctity/Degradation: purity vs contamination
prompt_configuration.scoring_approach: Score each foundation pair on how strongly the positive or negative pole is emphasized, using 0.0-1.0 scale with specific textual evidence

validation.political_correlation: Strong correlation with liberal-conservative political orientation
